column5:
Thanks for the reply! I have to keep remembering that: I donâ€™t owe any employer and they owe me nothing as well, especially with these at-will employment laws and the fact that they have no problem replacing any of us in a hot second. Stupidly, I get my feelings involved and â€œfeel badâ€ about doing whatâ€™s best for me.

Iâ€™m going to go to this place and feel it out. Most importantly, I think I need to go in with a more assertive attitude/ Iâ€™m usually so accommodating as though I should be on my knees thanking them for deigning to hire me. 

Thanks again.

Thatâ€™s what I always think! Iâ€™ve been the only and I do not enjoy it one bit- itâ€™s uncomfortable to say the least and at times, degrading. Whenever I spot another black person in a white space I want to trip over myself to be best friends with them but I try to play it cool because everyoneâ€™s not a weirdo like myself and I probably scare them ğŸ˜‚

Iâ€™ve found that in some instances, there are those of us who have become so accustomed to being the â€œonly oneâ€ in a white space-whether we or not we are comfortable with it- that we feel threatened for some reason when another of â€œusâ€ comes around. Itâ€™s a weird thing.

I made the mistake of mentioning to my mother that maybe, perhaps I could not return this afternoon for dinner because I didnâ€™t have the energy to be around people ( I stayed over my parentsâ€™ last night but needed to go back to my place to shower and do hair and makeup). Well that was like setting off a bomb. She just kept saying â€œfine but I donâ€™t know why you canâ€™t just have dinnerâ€ and â€œ Iâ€™m not going to beg you to stay.â€ 

I didnâ€™t want her to beg me to come to dinner. I just want for once for someone to say something like, â€œ Iâ€™m sorry youâ€™re feeling like this, that sucks, I donâ€™t know what I can do but I under of youâ€™re not up to being â€œonâ€ today.â€ Iâ€™m not looking for anyone in my life to â€œcureâ€ me or make it all better, just acknowledgement that this thing/depression is in me and know that if I could make it go away at the snap of a finger I so, so would.

The night before, I tried reaching out to some friends about how I was feeling and the response was to turn it into a joke and then continue talking about Xmas shopping.

I really feel that all of this what seems to be a push for people to reach out and listen to friends and loved one about mental health is all for media show. Real people donâ€™t want to go to deep when it gets real.

I have to go back to my parentsâ€™. How do I get through it??

I would love more info on this or to be pointed in the direction of resources that focus on the mental health of black people forced to be slaves- children being ripped from mothers, the rampant rape, I donâ€™t even have to mention the disgusting violence.
Can Navient get in on this too??

Thank you everyone for the advice- no one in my life can really understand, either they think itâ€™s crazy to commit to someone so far away or they think we would essentially be wasting 2 years of our lives so I thought iâ€™d turn to the professionals, you all! Thanks again- I have to summon up the courage and also be prepared for him to not want to do this, which is what I fear the most- I keep thinking I could have made a better case if I had opened up earlier. Thanks again I really appreciate the responses.
Wait, at the risk of sounding trump-level stupid, did he really say this??
